titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Sub-Committee on Entertainment of the Committee on the Centennial Celebration of the Inauguration of George Washington as President of the United States minutes 1978.021
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-17T14:21-0500

did.unittitle: Sub-Committee on Entertainment of the Committee on the Centennial Celebration of the Inauguration of George Washington as President of the United States minutes
did.abstract: The meeting minutes of the Sub-Committee on Entertainment of the Committee on the Centennial Celebration of the Inauguration of George Washington as President of the United States are housed in a single volume and cover the period 1888 to 1889. The year 1889 marked the centennial of the inauguration of George Washington as President of the United States. On February 3, 1889, the Committee on the Centennial Celebration appointed a sub-committee entitled the Committee on Entertainment with Stuyvesant Fish as Chairman. The event took place on April 29 and 30, 1889 at the Metropolitan Opera House.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Committee on the Centennial Celebration. Sub-Committee on Entertainment.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Sub-Committee on Entertainment of the Committee on the Centennial Celebration of the Inauguration of George Washington as President of the United States minutes, 1978.021, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1978.
